Re Accounting for plane usage in year it News Release from FASB FASB Reaches Tentative Decision on Accounting for Purchased Goodwill Accountingrawfasbnewsnrhtml Forwarded by John KeiserFGTEnron on PM Rod Hayslett PM To Mike McGowanET NRON cc Dave WaymireET NRON John NRON James NRON Tracy NRON Steve GilbertET NRON John NRON Subject Re Accounting for plane usage in year We are still working on the plane and the answer is that the plane will be billed to the RC reserving it for the flight If commercial wants to take it to a lower level than that it will be up to them to do so It will take some actual doing on our side to make this happen but it can be done The budget will be taken care of in Planning as we go through the year From an ETS point of view all of the plane is in Commercial or Executive Stan and so it should not be a problem to track the budget Tracy has the point on this one Jim Saunders What do you know about the other comments Mike McGowan AM To Rod NRON cc Dave WaymireET NRON John NRON Subject Accounting for plane usage in year Rod I never heard back from you on this airplane accounting issue for year Any thoughts on timing as to who we can work with to finalize by year end Can we work with Dave Waymire here in Omaha Also there was an article in this past Sundays World Herald that FASB has reversed its position on merger accounting and will not require firms to amortize Goodwill over time and write it off against current income of a merged company In addition the new plan would eliminate the pooling of interest restrictions and allow merged companies to sell off unwanted assets prior to the two year waing period now required Im not sure if this revision would be applicable to mergers which occurred before this FASB revision or not Do you have any insights on this Thank You Mike McGowan Forwarded by Mike McGowanETSEnron on AM Mike McGowan AM To Rod NRON cc Danny McCartyET nron Courtney BarkerET nron Subject Accounting for plane usage in year Rod we have discussed the accounting for plane uasage on year and have determined that the actual trip costs will be billed direct to the users RC However the budget costs for the plane have been included in Dan McCartys executive RC budget Thus we will have to develop a procedure to charge the RC for atctual costs but credit the plane budget and maintain some control as to the overall status of the budget Who would you like me to work with to developcoordinate these procedures Thanks

FW Andersen Oil Gas SymposiumThis is what I sent to Jim a few days ago from my understanding They were going to charge us for cancellations So we will have to fight the bill Original Message From Keiser John Sent Monday November PM To Saunders James Subject RE Andersen Oil Gas Symposium I talked with Sabrina Whaley who is the contact at Enron for this Symposium If you signed up prior to two weeks ago there was a discount off the price Both Henry and Sally signed up and got the discount which I confirmed with Sabrina If you want to sign up now the price skyrocketed to each Wow If they signed up and cancel now there is no refund but someone else could go in their place so let them just go Original Message From Saunders James Sent Monday November AM To Campos Kathy Daily Pamela Peters Jerry Geaccone Tracy Brassfield Morris Barnes Caroline Jesse III John Borcyk David Cherry Paul Konsdorf Ellen Chandler Bob Cobb Jr John Wiederholt Patricia Fancler Dan Lev Jennifer Sutton Lisa Gilbert Steve Keiser John Centilli James Rosenberg David E Tu Denis Brasher Barney Clements David Concklin Elaine Stern Ellis Ratner Michael Chavez Gabriel Gonzalez Martin Lee Jebong Schroeder Maggie Cc Guthrie Robert Rice Greek Schick Warren Tilotta Robert W Svatos Dee Jolibois Anne Mayes Cynthia Schaffer Brian Jones Dana Sullivan Michael Baker Lee Hayslett Rod Subject Andersen Oil Gas Symposium After Rods staff mtg on Friday we followed up w Andersen on attendance discounts related to the above annual meeting and Andersen indicated no discountinterested attendees would have to pay full amount

FW Phase Comparison Plan vs Dave Analysis Cc Please see the attached comparison of the Phase that we have in the Plan versus Daves analysis For the Plan we ran it with and without Phase to determine the incremental change The worksheet attached also shows the Returns on Equity and Capitalization with and without based on the Plan runs You will have a reasonable applestoapples if you compare the amounts at the Operating Income level because Dave did not assume how it was financed in his analysis however my depreciation is GAAP but Daves is Tax There are only two significant differences For conservatism Dave used the settled rate rather than the rate refund floor rate in In Daves calculations this made a difference of about cents cts vs cts for the customers other than FPL in There is no difference for FPL because their rate cap is cts lower than either the settled or rate refund floor rates Per Dave in the risk analyses the rate refund floor impact WAS included We got a lower Ad Valorem tax estimate from Ted Ryan than what Dave used

Gruber Meeting on Plan still onWe are still on with Greg on Thursday Nov th am but since Greg will now be downtown he has agreed to meet in Rods office Do you guys want to meet ahead of the meeting to review or discuss the package
Personal Reorg IdeasWhen Tuesday November AM AM GMT Central Time US Canada Where Rods office

FW Northern Natural GasPST FYI Original Message From General NRON on behalf of Stan Horton Chairman CEO of Enron Global NRON Sent Thu PM To All ETS NRON Cc Subject Northern Natural Gas Dear ETS Colleague On Thursday January Enron entered into a settlement over Dynegys exercise of its option to acquire the Northern Natural Gas pipeline The settlement allows Dynegy to exercise the option and assume interim control of the pipeline while Enron pursues its damage claim against Dynegy In this respect Enron Corp has carefully weighed the substantial costs and turmoil that litigating this possession issue would create for the company and the employees of Northern Natural Gas Consequently Enron Corp has decided not to contest interim possession and allow the transfer of Northern Natural Gas to Dynegy while the larger issues affecting its future are resolved The company has concluded that with this settlement Enron should be able to resolve the issue more quickly as well as avoid the legal cost burden and distractions to the business from protracted litigation in state court For the Northern Natural Gas employees I believe this decision should allow them to steer clear of the dispute and focus on the daytoday satisfaction of running a valuable successful business Beginning immediately we will be working to achieve a smooth transition and to align the appropriate resources to assure continued safe reliable and efficient operation of Northern Natural Gas Over many years we have run high quality cost conscious and profitable businesses in ETS Keep up the good work Stan

Plan Assumptions with Stan am Cc I talked with Rod about the purpose of the meeting Stan wants to start thinking about the assumptions for the rate case and a ten year Plan I will bring the Plan but it is really a shortterm Plan and Rod does not want me to hand out anything It is a strategy session We assumed in the Plan a rate drop effective I would like to review the assumptions behind that with Teb and Blair to better understand how it was derived This will be one of the major issues for discussion
Assumption topicsSee attached Comments
Revised Assumption Discussion Points for hand outPotential discussion points in handout for Stan meeting Wednesday Feb am EBMDining

Business plan outline and time tableThere will be a meeting this Friday with Stan to review the financial forecasts No time set So we are hustling to get something done by end of today Hey guys Rod is telling me we have to get the Business Plan done soon Once we meet with Stan this Friday we will get more guidance on completing the Business Plan whose outline is below Rod said the Business Plan will need to be completed in the next couple of weeks We can review the Plan Outline and assign sections Much is Marketing oriented Please review the Outline below so it can be discussed on Friday with Stan Original Message From Hayslett Rod Sent Wednesday February PM To Howard Kevin A Keiser John Geaccone Tracy Peters Jerry Piro Jim Cc Horton Stanley Stark Cindy Subject Business plan outline and time table Importance High Please treat this as confidential Each of you will be responsible for pulling together detailed plans for and a year forecasting model to support a REORG case We really need the basic information just mentioned above yesterday Please let me know when I can get it but I need it tomorrow Stan would like to review everything by tuesday next week Assignments for Regulated North America Kevin for Stan NNG and Coordination Johnfor Bob CitrusFGT Tracyfor Steve Transwestern Jerryfor Bill NB Entities Jimfor Peggy Portland General For each of you you will need to pull together the basic information required in the The Company part of the Business plan outline for your entity Note on the timeline the expectations of the Batchelder people Very optimistic but we probably can get there by early next week I will keep you informed as things change EMAIL FROM Batchelder crew Attached are two documents a time table for the ReOrg Co detailed business plan and subsequent valuation calculations and a draft outline for the business plan If possible we would like to meet with each of the business unit heads next week to make sure this time table is reasonable as well as ensure that the various pieces of the business plan are assigned to specific individuals within the business units We would welcome any input you have on the business plan outline as well as the overall process I know this is a very large time consuming project and we greatly appreciate your continued efforts in this entire process Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns Kathy Scott Batchelder Partners Inc x cell
rd CE review with DannyNonPrivilegedpst Review rd Current Estimate Net Commercial Contributions with Danny prior to submission to ETS Planning on Bring whomever else you require

Commercial Plan McCarty Review lunch to servedNonPrivilegedpst Dave Neubauer Kent Miller will be in Houston Review Commercial Margins OM and Capital Budgets Margins will be first on the agenda Lunch will be provided Please send me a list of others whom you wish to attend so we can get them on the lunch list John Keiser Tracy Gecccone attending Tracy extended invite to Eric Gadd on Eric Gadd will have to leave meeting at ish Arrange Agenda accordingly to cover Erics area before departure Note to Tracy Geaccone Email announcement for Enron AllEmployee meeting at potential conflict As per Tracy Geaccone this is your meeting and Stan is not attending It is your meeting and up to you if you wish to reschedule Danny advised that the meeting will proceed but break at to attend the Enron AllEmployee meeting and reconvene at Lunch to be delivered at Tracy to arrange Agenda accordingly

Weekly Commercial Net ContributionDanny we polled the three pipes and they made no change from the November th Forecast We did publish the Weekly which will be viewable on November rd on the Website just repeating the same Forecast Have a good holiday
Weekly Net Commercial Contribution Summary on the WebsiteDanny be aware that I just got the NNG info and the Summary has been changed just now so anything you looked at prior to today is obsolete

AR info from Jerry SkertichWanted to let you know that the monthly AR file which Jerry keeps up and the analysis of timing of when we receive payments has helped us tremendously with our Cash Flow forecasting This is a tool we are using throughout the month
